duties_responsibilities.duty: Complete Diagnostic Assessments using trauma-responsive, culturally responsive, and age-appropriate assessment tools, resulting in clinical diagnosis.
Develop individualized treatment plans which define plan of services and intervention; update treatment plans according to regulatory requirements; and provide optimum client care.
Serve a client base of primarily youth and their families; 80% of NYFS clients are between 4 and 26 years of age.
Involve client caregivers in assessment and treatment planning process, and in care when indicated.
Independently provide individual, couple and family therapy as needed to address client treatment needs and provide crisis intervention services as appropriate.
Complete documentation and billing in a timely manner in accordance with NYFS guidelines and all relevant HIPAA and DHS guidelines.
Provide culturally responsive, trauma-responsive, community-based, and developmentally appropriate care.
Actively contribute to weekly case consultation, staff meetings, and agency and community events as assigned.
Abide by all professional ethical standards.

education_certification.credential: Master’s or PhD in Social Work, Psychology, Professional Counseling, or Marriage and Family Therapy
